subject_line: New Video: Compiling Sass with Grunt and Gulp
title: AtoZ Sass
episode_summary: In this week's video we'll be diving into two command line tools that can help you compile Sass. They both do a *lot* more than just compile Sass so they're definitely worth looking in to. But for the purposes of keeping this video short and to the point, we'll just focus on the Sass side of things.

news.link_text: Advanced CSS Selectors You Really May Not Have Heard of and If You Have You Probably Haven't Used Them
news.link_comment: Does exactly as the title suggests. How many have you heard of? How many have you used?

news.link_text: Finally, CSS in Javascript! Meet CSSX
news.link_comment: People on Twitter have been going crazy over this article. It's great but do we really want or need CSS in JS?

news.link_text: BEM and SMACSS: Advice From Developers Who've Been There
news.link_comment: This post from SitePoint offers a good intro to these two methodologies and some advice from seasoned pros. Worth a read.

news.link_text: RichCSS: CSS That Doesn't Drive You Nuts
news.link_comment: RichCSS is an Object Oriented CSS framework providing default structures for reusable css elements. Great work, Rich :)

news.link_text: Meet the First Visual Flexbox Builder
news.link_comment: Webflow is a powerful tool for visually building websites. This flexboox tool looks mighty impressive. Maybe you can skip attending my Flexbox workshop after all!
